content.value_statement: An AI skill for Claude, Codex, and Claude Code
actual_capabilities: Generate React/Next.js components with TypeScript using automated scaffolding templates
Analyze JavaScript bundle sizes and provide performance optimization recommendations
Scaffold complete frontend projects with React, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS configurations
Apply best practices for component architecture, state management, and UI patterns
Optimize Next.js applications for performance including caching and critical path optimization
Review frontend code for quality, security, and adherence to established patterns
limitations: Requires Python runtime environment to execute the three automation scripts
Scripts need file system write access to generate components and configuration files
Bundle analysis depends on existing build output and webpack/Next.js configuration
Does not provide real-time debugging or runtime error analysis
Limited to React/Next.js ecosystem - does not support Vue, Angular, or other frameworks

use_cases.title: Component Scaffolding
use_cases.description: Quickly generate new React components with TypeScript definitions, test files, and style modules following team conventions and best practices.
use_cases.target_user: Frontend developers building new features who want to ensure consistency and save time on boilerplate code

use_cases.title: Performance Optimization
use_cases.description: Analyze production bundles to identify large dependencies, code splitting opportunities, and performance bottlenecks with actionable recommendations.
use_cases.target_user: Senior engineers optimizing application load times and investigating performance issues in production

use_cases.title: Project Initialization
use_cases.description: Bootstrap new frontend projects with pre-configured Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and testing setup aligned with modern best practices.
use_cases.target_user: Tech leads starting new projects or prototypes who need production-ready configuration quickly

use_cases.title: Code Review Assistance
use_cases.description: Review React code for anti-patterns, security issues, and deviations from established best practices documented in the reference guides.
use_cases.target_user: Teams conducting code reviews and wanting automated checks for common frontend issues

prompt_templates.scenario: When starting a new frontend application or proof of concept

prompt_templates.title: Review Code Quality

output_examples.input: Review this component for performance issues
output_examples.output: Identified 3 issues: (1) Missing React.memo for expensive render, (2) Inline function creation in render causing unnecessary re-renders, (3) useEffect missing dependency array. Recommended fixes: wrap component with React.memo, move handler to useCallback, add proper dependencies to useEffect.

best_practices: Use TypeScript for all components with proper interface definitions and type safety
Follow component composition patterns and keep components focused on single responsibility
Implement proper error boundaries and loading states for async operations
Optimize bundle size by using dynamic imports and code splitting for large components
Write comprehensive tests for components including unit tests and integration tests
Use semantic HTML and ARIA attributes for accessibility compliance
Implement proper caching strategies with Next.js ISR and client-side caching
Keep dependencies updated and regularly audit for security vulnerabilities
Document complex logic and architectural decisions in code comments
Monitor production performance with metrics and error tracking
anti_patterns: Avoid prop drilling more than 2-3 levels deep - use Context API or state management instead
Don't fetch data in useEffect without proper cleanup and cancellation handling
Avoid inline arrow functions in JSX render that cause unnecessary re-renders
Don't import entire libraries when tree-shaking is possible (e.g., import all of lodash)
Avoid using index as key in lists with dynamic data that can be reordered
Don't skip dependency arrays in useEffect or useCallback to avoid stale closures
Avoid tight coupling between components - prefer composition over inheritance
Don't ignore TypeScript errors or use 'any' type as a quick fix
Avoid committing .env files with secrets or sensitive configuration to version control

faq.question: What frameworks and tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill supports React, Next.js, React Native, and Flutter for frontend development. It works with TypeScript and JavaScript, uses Tailwind CSS for styling, and includes Python automation scripts for component generation, bundle analysis, and project scaffolding.

faq.question: Do I need Python installed to use this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, the three automation scripts (component_generator.py, bundle_analyzer.py, frontend_scaffolder.py) require Python to be installed. However, the reference documentation and best practices guides can be used without Python.

faq.question: Can this skill work with existing projects or only new ones?
faq.answer: This skill works with both new and existing projects. The scaffolder can initialize new projects, while the component generator and bundle analyzer can be used on existing codebases to add new components or optimize performance.

faq.question: What kind of performance optimizations does the bundle analyzer recommend?
faq.answer: The bundle analyzer identifies large dependencies, suggests tree-shaking opportunities, recommends lazy loading for non-critical code, identifies duplicate dependencies, and provides guidance on code splitting strategies to reduce initial bundle size and improve load times.

faq.question: How does this skill ensure security in frontend code?
faq.answer: The skill includes security best practices such as input validation, XSS prevention, proper authentication patterns, secure dependency management, and environment variable handling. It recommends regular dependency audits and following OWASP guidelines for frontend security.
